repo.name: chadwick
repo.description: Chadwick tools for manipulating baseball data

readme.summary: Clear purpose statement but lacks any usage examples or quick start guide in the README itself.
readme.top_issue: No usage examples or quick start in README - users must visit external documentation to learn how to actually use any of the command-line utilities

critical_findings: Potential buffer overflow vulnerability in cw_strtok function
No validation for user input can lead to potential security issues
security.summary: The code appears to be generally secure, but lacks proper input validation and error handling, which could potentially lead to security vulnerabilities.

common_complaints: Installation and dependency issues (shared library linking, Windows/WSL compatibility)
Tool output issues (empty files, incorrect data formatting)
Data parsing bugs (pitcher ID marking, runner tracking, time format ambiguity)
Documentation gaps (incomplete installation instructions, outdated field documentation)
praise_themes: Feature requests are well-articulated and specific
Community contributes detailed bug reports with concrete examples
Issues labeled appropriately with priority indicators (good first issue, enhancement)
sentiment.summary: Chadwick shows active community engagement with well-documented issues, moderate maintainer responsiveness evidenced by closed issues, but struggles with installation barriers and data handling edge cases that frustrate new users.

red_flags: Occasional dismissive tone towards new contributors
communication.summary: Responses are generally clear and technical, but could be more welcoming to new contributors.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being recent (2026-01-03)
20 open issues with no resolution activity
Zero closed issues in past 6 months indicating no bug fixes
No merged PRs in past 6 months suggesting no active development
No active contributors in past 6 months
Unknown last release date suggests release tracking may be broken or inactive
positive_signals: Recent commit exists (2026-01-03), indicating repository is not completely dead
maintenance.summary: The chadwick package appears abandoned with no maintenance activity over the past 6 months despite having significant open issues.

changelog.summary: The changelog lacks important details such as breaking changes, migration guides, and proper categorization, making it very incomplete and unclear.

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The README provides a clear introduction and installation instructions, but lacks examples, configuration documentation, and troubleshooting guidance.
concerns: No merged PRs in the past six months, indicating a lack of community contribution or approval.
Only one open issue and no closed issues in the past six months suggest that reported problems are not being addressed.
Docs: Lack of quick start example and documentation for common use cases
Communication: Occasional dismissive tone towards new contributors
Security: Potential buffer overflow vulnerability in cw_strtok function
Security: No validation for user input can lead to potential security issues
High bus factor risk (98% from top contributor)
highlights: One contributor has been active in the past six months, which is better than none.
The package was last released over a year ago but had recent commits, showing some level of activity.
